channel.title: torbrowser script bug - cannot open local files that contain spaces
channel.description:
i have saved a website in the form of .html , but when i double click on it i get this error message:-
qubes 3.1rc , whonix 12 tester repository , TBB 5.0.7
`########################################################### ## torbrowser script bug. ## No panic. Nothing is broken. Just some rare condition ## has been hit. Try again later. There is likely a ## solution for this problem. Please see the Whonix News, ## Whonix User Help Forum and Whonix Documentation. ## https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser ## Please report this bug! ## ## BASH_COMMAND: /usr/lib/open_link_confirmation $other_args ## exit_code: 1 ## ## output: /usr/lib/msgcollector/msgcollector ## output_opts: --icon /usr/share/icons/anon-icon-pack/tbupdate.ico --parentpid 3358 --identifier torbrowser --parenttty none --whoami user ## progressbaridx: ## ## Experts only: ## bash -x torbrowser ###########################################################`
to reproduce this , go for example to http://sharetext.net then type anything and click on submit then save/download the link , then double click on the .html link which is located in the download folder. (open it with TBB) = there.

item.title: torbrowser script bug - cannot open local files that contain spaces
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Confirmed. Thanks for your report!

There is an upstream bug involved here that I just reported.
The Tor Project Bug report
start-tor-browser.desktop parameter passing broken on spaces
https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/18022

Fixes will appear in Whonix 13. And at some point in the testers repository.

github.com/Whonix/open-link-confirmation

better use "$@" for better compatibility; 

no more need to add --new-tab
http://forums.whonix.org/t/torbrowser-script-bug/1893/1
by adrelanos on 03:35PM - 08 Jan 16
changed 1 files with 2 additions and 2 deletions.
github.com/Whonix/tb-starter

Workaround upstream bug to allow opening local files with file names that contain spaces. 

prefer Browser/start-tor-browser over
start-tor-browser and
start-tor-browser.desktop
Preferring $tb_browser_folder/Browser/start-tor-browser to work around
The Tor Project upstream issue:
'start-tor-browser.desktop parameter passing broken on spaces'
https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/18022
code simplification / refactoring
Thanks to...
by adrelanos on 03:53PM - 08 Jan 16
changed 2 files with 122 additions and 181 deletions.

Please re-test this in Whonix 13 testers-only release or when the
tb-starter package is updated. Will take a while. No ETA yet.

Read full topic
item.source: torbrowser script bug - cannot open local files that contain spaces
